title: The Last Appointment
fullSolutionText: You traced the timing, inconsistencies, and pharmacology. Dr. Sienna Hale is the killer.

reveal.motive: Professional rivalry and risk management; the victim had warned that someone was in her files.
reveal.method: A lethal Triazolam dose potentiated by wine, staged as a locked-room self-harm.
evidence: CCTV shows Hale entering at 19:59 and no recorded exit before TOD.
Vial with no prints; unknown partial on the glass.
Door locked from inside; spare unlabeled key in the desk; phone missing.
reveal.epilogue: You didn’t just name the killer—you proved the motive and the method. Case closed.

title: Forty-Eight Hours: A Cyanide Mystery
fullSolutionText: You pieced together the forensics, receipts, and draft article. Daniel Harper is guilty.

reveal.motive: To prevent Ethan Cole from publishing an exposé that would destroy Harper & Cole Technologies and expose fraudulent supplement ties.
reveal.method: Harper tampered with a bottle of 'Vitamin Boost – Energy Formula,' disguising it with a counterfeit label and ensuring Ethan consumed it within 48 hours.
evidence: Draft article directly names Harper & Cole Technologies in the fraud.
Lot code K3T-482 from the foil fragment matches the counterfeit bottle.
Transaction log shows the package delivery under suspicious initials.
Harper’s message: 'Some doors can’t be closed once opened.'
timeline: Sept 19 – Heated argument with Ethan at the office.
Sept 20 13:20 – Package delivered (Harper orchestrated counterfeit supplement).
Sept 20 evening – Ethan consumed supplement believing it was legitimate.
Sept 21 morning – Ethan collapses, later reports his own murder.
reveal.epilogue: You didn’t just name the killer—you reconstructed the fraud, the package tampering, and Harper’s motive. Case closed.

incorrect.generic: Not quite. Recheck the online order (lot code K3T-482), Harper’s threats, and the draft article evidence.
